name: relook
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of thinking carefully about a subject again so that you can make a new decision about it: The senator called for a relook at the care system. I am sure the authorities will have a re-look at this proposal.
More examplesFewer examplesThe jet was the result of a complete relook at the principles of aircraft design.We need to take a relook at the way financial markets work.The whole educational system needs a relook.
